intro: Crepidiastrum hallaisanense, commonly known as the Hallaisan bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with a fine, hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
